brainly_data.question: What is Fitzgerald saying about the theme dream in chapter 6 of the great gatsby?
brainly_data.subject: English

all_answers.question: What is Fitzgerald saying about the theme dream in chapter 6 of the great gatsby?
all_answers.subject: English
all_answers.text: Dreams are starting to shatter a bit in this chapter of the novel. When Tom and Daisy are both at Gatsby's party, it's clear that nothing is simple and easy and that the dream Gatsby has of keeping Daisy forever might be flawed. Nick tries to tell him that he can't repeat the past, but Gatsby doesn't believe it.
